loans.name: Maria Bernarda

texts.es: La señora María Bernarda a sus 51 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace aproximadamente tres años. La señora María Bernarda trabaja sola en los ratos que tiene libres. La señora Bernarda desea comprar surtido de ropa con el fin de ampliar sus ventas y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida. La señora María Bernarda sueña con tener su propio salón de eventos especiales puesto que la señora María Bernarda cocina muy bien y con este, poder apoyar económicamente a su madre y hermana quienes son las personas que viven con ella.
texts.en: Mrs. Maria Bernarda, at 51 years old, has been selling clothes for about three years. Mrs. María Bernarda works alone in her spare time.  Mrs. Bernarda wishes to buy an assortment of clothing in order to expand her sales and thus improve her income and quality of life. Mrs. Maria Bernarda dreams of having her own special events hall since Mrs. Maria Bernarda cooks very well and with this, to be able financially to support her mother and sister, the people who live with her.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells maize porridge and bread in Besease. Ama is married to a farmer and has two children. She has been selling porridge and bread for 12 years.  She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase maize and flour. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase materials to make traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Jaques

texts.en: Jaques is 35 years old and married to a nurse. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling food and milk to his customers. He is applying for a loan to buy a cow and more food to sell. He plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to set aside some savings and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 40 years old and married with six children aged from 1 to 22; three of the children attend school. She has been selling fish for the last 10 years.

The loan will be used to buy more fish and meat for sale. Peace will use the profits to renovate her house and create savings for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 37 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 20 and 14. She runs a beauty salon and has been in business for 13 years. Right now her monthly income from the business is 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She is borrowing a loan of 20,000 KES which she intends to use to purchase a dryer for salon work. She plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business and to open another business.

This her first loan and her hopes and dreams are to see her business grow to another level.

loans.use: to buy a dryer for her salon

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a single parent with one child. She is a petty trader at Besease near Elmina and has been in this business for the past five years. Comfort is responsible for the upkeep of her child. She will use her loan to buy more goods for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y extrovertida, es conviviente con José que es carpintero. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de sys 5 hijos de 20, 18, 17, 5 y 2 años de edad, además de una nieta.
La actividad que realiza Felicita es la carpintería labor que comparte con su pareja, y lo ejecuta en un pequeño taller instalado en su propia casa. En un inicio empezaron con un pequeño capital propio con el cual lograron comprar maquinas de corte de madera, atendiendo pedidos. Al cabo de 4 años, han logrado crecer y desarrollar su negocio y ahora cuentan con el apoyo de dos ayudantes a los que paga por semana de trabajo.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos del hogar, así como la educación de sus hijos, a los que quiere mucho. Por eso se esfuerza día a día, logrando tener su recompensa con la buena ganancias que le genera, por esa razón tiene planes de ampliar su casa y tener más espacio para implementar con maquinas para tener mejores acabados de sus trabajos.
Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado  se siente bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros se buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevo soles, comprará un motor cepilladora, valorizada en 600 nuevos soles, y con el saldo comprará más madera para sus trabajos.
texts.en: Felicita, 39 years old, is a hardworking woman, enthusiastic, cheerful and outgoing, who lives with her partner Joseph, a carpenter. Together they live in their own home with their 5 children 20, 18, 17, 5 and 2 years old, and also a granddaughter. Felicita performs carpentry work which she shares with her partner and runs in a small workshop installed at home. Initially they started with a small amount of their own money with which they managed to buy wood cutting machines and take orders. After 4 years, they have managed to grow and develop their business and now they are supported by two assistants who she pays for the work week. What she likes about her activity is to have an income to cover the costs of home as well as the education of her children, whom she loves very much. So she strives every day, managing to be rewarded with good profits the business generates. For that reason she has plans to expand her home and have more room to implement machines to better finish their jobs. This will be loan number 10 with the institution MFP, so she hopes for a small loan in order to fulfill her objectives. On the other hand she feels good with her community bank because she considers its members good people. With the amount requested, 1000 nuevo soles, she will buy a planer motor, valued at 600 nuevos soles, and with the balance will buy more wood for their jobs.

loans.use: to buy a planer and more wood.

loans.name: Prudencienne

texts.en: Prudencienne is 53 years old and is a widow. She has five children between the ages of 5 and 25. She has been selling sorghum for over fifteen years. She would like a loan to buy more sorghum and beans to sell. Prudencienne will use the profits to build a new house and create savings for her family.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs such as sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cerveza y venta de chicha,ella tiene una picanteria donde realzia platos tipicos como cuy al horno,caldo de gallinas,chancho al horno entre otros platos,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de picanteria y negocio de venta de cerveza y chicha.La socia solicita para comprar cerveza,chicha y para comprar  productos para cocinar como carne,pollo,verduras y arroz al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member is in the business of selling beer and has a “picanteria”, a small family-style restaurant where she makes local dishes such as baked guinea pig, chicken broth, baked pork and other dishes.  The partner, through this business, moves ahead for her children.  The member wants to expand and improve her tavern and beer-selling business.  She is requesting a loan to buy beer, chicha (a Peruvian corn drink) and purchase cooking products such as meat, chicken, vegetables and rice in bulk. The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with payment of her quota.

loans.use: to buy beer, drinks and cooking products such as meat, chicken, vegetables and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Ndeye Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye est une mère de 3 enfants qui vit sur le territoire  sénégalais. L’âge  de ses  enfants varie entre 7 et 10 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément  dans  la vente de légumes ou elle capitalise une expérience de 4 ans. Auparavant elle vendait du poisson. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion. Mais elle est surtout intéressée  par les revenus qu’elle y gagne. Elle  est membre d’un  guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis  septembre 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de légumes  a revendre dans le but d’élargir , de diversifier d’avantage et de renforcer son activité de commerce. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permet d’améliorer ses conditions de vie sociales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye lives in Senegal and is the mother of three children, whose ages range from 7 to 10. She's a merchant, selling vegetables, a business in which she has four years of experience. Previously, she used to sell fish.

She chose this business out of passion, but she's especially interested in the income she earns from it. She's been a member of the local branch of Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, since September 2011.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 intended to buy vegetables to resell, in order to expand, bolster and diversify her business. Increasing her profits enables her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Yorlady Aide

texts.es: La señora Yordaly a sus 37 años de edad, presta desde la sala de su casa servicios de juegos y entretenimiento desde hace dos años. Este negocio surgió cuando la señora Yordaly detectó en el sector la necesidad de este tipo de negocio. El conocimiento para esta idea de negocio lo adquirió de su anterior trabajo. La señora Yordaly desea comprar un equipo para juegos y dos televisores, lo que le permitirá tener mayor capacidad para atender más clientes e incrementar sus ingresos y posicionar su negocio. Con lo anterior, la señora Yordaly podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La señora Yordaly sueña con colocar un local donde preste servicios de Internet y pueda brindar mejores servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Yordaly, 37, has a room of her home for games and entertainment services for the past two years. This business came when Mrs.Yordaly detected the need for this type of business in her neighborhood. She acquired the knowledge for this business idea from her previous work. Mrs. Yordaly wants to buy game equipment and two televisions, allowing her greater capacity to serve more customers and increase her income and position her business. With that, Mrs. Yordaly will be able to improve the quality of life for her family. Mrs. Yordaly dreams of installing a facility that provides Internet service and can provide better service her customers.

loans.use: to buy x-box and two televisions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Dorothea

texts.en: Dorothea is 47 years old and has two children who are 21 and 23 years old. She earns a living by running a store where she sells items such as rice, sugar and salt. She has been in this business for the last five years, and is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to begin building a house and to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a seamstress and also sells ladies bags and underwear at Besease near Elmina. She has been into sewing for 12 years now. She is married to a fisherman and has one child. Veronica assists her husband in paying utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags and materials for sewing.  She will use her new profit to get a shop for her sewing.

loans.use: purchase bags and materials for sewing

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con deseos de superación y decidida, está casada con Jorge, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 1 año de edad en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Merly es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, asimismo vende golosinas y bebidas gasificadas, en su tienda instalada en su casa, negocio que monto con un capital propio producto de sus ahorros hace 2 años. Desde entonces atiende a sus clientes, de manera amena y amable, ganándose así la confianza de ellos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar, como la alimentación y educación de sus hijos, además de sentirse una mujer independerte y productiva. Sin embargo, se atraza econçomicamente cuando alguno de sus clientes no pagan sus deudas. Ahora su anhelo es ampliar su negocio, diversificando el stock de productos. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso será puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Además, se siente cómoda con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de artículos en cantidades para la campaña navideña como artículos para hogar y personal, luces navideñas, árboles artificiales navideños y otros.
texts.en:
Thirty-three year old Merly is a hardworking, enterprising woman with a desire to succeed.  She’s married to Jorge and lives in her own home with her husband and two children, ages 14 and 1.  Merly sells primary needs products and also snacks and soft drinks from her general store in her home.  She started this business with her own capital; two years of savings.

Since then, she’s been serving her customers in an amenable, friendly way, while earning their trust.  What she enjoys about this business is being able to count on an income to take care of the household expenses, such as feeding and educating her children, as well as allowing her to be an independent and productive woman.  However, she falls behind financially when some of her customers don’t pay their debts.  Now she wants to expand her business and diversify its stock of products.

This will be her 10th loan through MFP and she’s grateful for the financial support to advance her business, so she promises to make her payments on time.  She considers the other members to be united and responsible.  She will invest the money from this loan for 1,000 PEN ($375) in large quantities of Christmas merchandise, like household and personal items, Christmas lights, artificial Christmas trees, and other things.

loans.use: to buy Christmas merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hair extensions

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 24 años una mujer trabajadora y responsable, convive con Wilmer, de 26 años, viven en casa alquilada junto a su pequeña hija Maribel de 07 años a quien le dan mucho amor y desean un futuro mejor para su hija. Hace 10 años que Nelly, se dedica a la agricultura, ahora junto a su pareja se van a trabajar desde muy temprano en sus tierras de cultivo donde producen cacao. Los productos de Nelly, son de buena cosecha y comenta que la gente que compra sus productos no se queja de los buenos granos de cacao que produce. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que lo hace junto a su pareja y ambos lo hacen con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo;  lo que se le hace difícil es no poder brindarle una casa propia para su pequeña hija ya que viven en casa alquilada. Con el tiempo desea construir una casa en la que pueda estar cómoda en especial su pequeña hija. Este es su préstamo numero 02 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para lograr su objetivo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal ya que trabaja con personas de responsabilidad. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar materiales de construcción como: fierros, alambres para que pueda avanzar con la construcción de propia casa.
texts.en:
Nelly, 24, a hard-working and responsible woman, lives with Wilmer, 26, in a rented house with their young daughter Maribel, 7, whom they love very much and for whom they want a better future.  Nelly has worked in agriculture for 10 years.  Now, she and her partner go to work very early to their fields where they grow cacao.  Nelly's products are of good quality and she comments that the people who buy her products do not complain about the good cacao beans that she produces.

What she likes most about her work is that she does it alongside her partner, and both do it with great dedication and effort.  The difficult part is not being able to give their daughter her own home, since they live in a rented house.  In time she wants to build a house in which she can be comfortable, especially her young daughter.

This is her second loan with MFP, for which she hopes for a small loan to achieve her objective.  She also likes to be part of her communal bank since she works with responsible people.

With the 1,000 PEN she will be able to buy construction materials such as metal and wire so she can move forward with the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy metal and wire.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells maize porridge and bread at Besease near Elmina. Esther is married to a farmer and has five children. She has been selling maize porridge, fish and kenkey for fifteen years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase bulk maize. With the new profit Esther will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize.

loans.name: Claver

texts.en: Claver is 45 years old and married to a businesswoman. He has seven children between the ages of 1 and 22. He has been selling shoes for the last 9 years. Claver would like a loan to buy more shoes to sell. He would like to use the profits to buy a plot of land and a cow.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sell.

loans.name: Genie

texts.es: Genie, tiene la edad  de 42 años, está casado y vive con su esposo.  Ella con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como el abano y plaguicidas para asistir su cafetal. Ella actualmente cuenta con un área cultivada de café en producción y esta cosecha es muy buena para ella, con esta mejora que le hará pretende darle a su cafetal fuerza para la producción y así cosechar obtener más rendimientos. Ella tiene como meta aumentar la cosecha para el próximo año, mejorar su cafetal de buena manera y así obtener de esta un mejor rendimiento mejorando así su nivel de vida y calidad económica de su futuro para un mejor bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Genie is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband.  She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide for her coffee plantation.  She currently has an area producing coffee and this is a very good crop for her.  This improvement will give her plantation greater strength for production and this will improve the harvest, giving her a better return.

She has a goal of increasing her harvest next year, improving her plantation, and having a better return on her investment.  This will allow her to improve her quality of life and economic future to improve her family’s well-being.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to improve her cofffee plantation.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a seamstress and also sells ladies bags and underwear at Besease near Elmina. She has been into sewing for ten years. She is married to a fisherman and has three children. Rose assists her husband in paying utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags and materials for sewing. Rose will use her new profit to get more machines for sewing.

loans.use: to purchase bags and materials for sewing.

loans.name: Duo Paz Y Amor Group

texts.es:
DUO PAZ  Y AMOR
La Srita. Elsa Elizabeth es una joven trabajadora que se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y frutas en le mercado municipal, también sale a vender en días de mercado ella realiza esta actividad porque es el medio que la a ayudado a salir adelante y poder apoyar a sus padres en la economía de su familia, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace siete años tiene ya varios clientes  que la conocen como buena vendedora y en ocasiones le hacen pedidos de verduras por docenas, lamentablemente ella no cuenta con un capital grande para poder entregar estos pedios es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas y verduras. Olga Rosario, ella se dedica a la venta de refacción por la mañana sale a vender  en una escuela de la comunidad donde vive  y por la tarde vende en la plaza municipal vendiendo atol , chuchitos, tostadas y otros productos, ella necesita un capital para poder salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres que son de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Elsa Elizabeth is a young worker who buys and sells vegetables and fruits in the municipal market.  She also goes out to sell on market days.  She does this work because it has helped her get ahead and she can support her parents.  She has done this work for seven years and she has many customers who know her as a good seller.  Occasionally, they will order vegetables in bulk, and unfortunately, she does not have enough capital to fill those orders.  She is asking for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables.  

Olga Rosario works selling snacks.  In the morning, she sells near a school in the community where she lives, and in the afternoon she sells in the town plaza.  She sells atol [corn based drink], chuchitos [type of tamale], tostadas [corn tortillas topped with salsa], and other products.  She needs the loan to get ahead and help her parents, who have few resources.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: La señora María Cecilia se dedica junto con sus cinco hijos en su finca a la producción agropecuaria, específicamente a la compra y venta de ganado y pollos. La señora María Cecilia desea comprar ganado y realizar mejoras locativas tal como arreglo de piso y techo al lugar donde viven sus pollos. Lo anterior, le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta forma poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia. A futuro la señora María Cecilia desea tener su finca más productiva y con más animales.
texts.en:
María Cecilia works along with her five children in agricultural production, specifically buying and selling livestock and chickens.  

María Cecilia wants to buy livestock and make home improvements such as fixing the floor and the roof of the place where her chickens live.  This will allow her to increase her earnings and so be able to improve the living conditions and well-being of her family.

In the future María Cecilia wants to have her farm more productive and with more animals.

loans.use: to buy livestock and to make home improvements.

loans.name: Maripsa Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Maripsa tiene 37 años y vive en la aldea del Centro en el municipio de Santa Cruz. Maripsa es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 15 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. 

Maripsa especializa en la venta de mercadería como blusas, pantalones, calcetas, y faldas entre otras cosas. Inició su negocio justo después de que nació su primer hijo debido a la necesidad de tener un fuente de ingreso en su hogar. Lo empezó con fondos propios y el negocio ha superado a través del uso de créditos de L25,000 y L30,000. 

Solicitó este crédito de L10,000 para la compra de blusas, faldas y pantalones para surtir su inventario. Su meta es seguir trabajando con créditos para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maripsa is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of El Centro in the town of Santa Cruz. She is a single mother and has two children (ages 8 and 15) who are in school.

Maripsa specializes in the sale of merchandise such as blouses, trousers, socks, skirts, and other items. She started her business right after her first child was born because she needed to have a source of household income. Maripsa established this business with her own funds and eventually utilized loans in the amounts of 25,000 HNL and 30,000 HNL.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 in order to buy blouses, skirts, and trousers to restock her inventory. Her goal is to continue working with loans so that her business can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and trousers to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia, es una mujer trabajadora D. 46 años, esta casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 07 hijos a quienes desea ofrecerles mejor calidad D. vida. Natalia, se dedica a L. agricultura, desD. muy temprano se va a su campo D. cultivo para ver las necesidades que puedan tener sus plantas D. caco y café. Para Natalia, su trabajo es muy importante, por eso le dedica tiempo para tener buenas cosechas y venderlas a un buen precio ya que sus productos son muy buenos. Lo que más le gusta D. trabajo es el ver sus abundantes frutos después D. tanto esfuerzo y considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir contra las plagas D. bicho o insectos que perjudican L. producción. Aun así no pierD. las esperanzas D. seguir adelante y con el préstamo solicitado podrá hacer el mantenimiento respectivo D. sus cultivos como: sacar L. maleza y fertilizarlos. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por tanto espera D. un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con su trabajo. Además le agrada ser parte D. banco comunal ya que son personas responsables y solidarias. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará abono y contratará peones para que le ayuden en sacar L. maleza D. entre sus plantas.
texts.en:
Natalia is a hardworking woman.  She’s 46 years old, married, and lives in a home of her own along with her husband and her seven children to whom she wants to proviD. a better quality of life.  She’s a farmer and arises very early each day to care for her coffee and cacao plants.

For Natalia, her work is very important.  This is why she dedicates lots of time to produce a good harvest so that she can sell them for good prices because the quality is very good.  What she enjoys mostly about her work is seeing the fruits of her labor after so much work.  She considers the most difficult part to be fighting the plant diseases and insects that ruin her crops.

Never the less, she doesn’t lose the hope of continuing to get ahead and she’ll be able to maintain her crops with the money from this loan, by removing the weeds and applying fertilizer.  This will be her second loan through MFP and she’s asking for a small loan so that she can complete her work.  She’s also glad to be a part of her communal bank, because its members are united and responsible.  She will use the money from this loan of 2,000 PEN to buy fertilizer and hire field hands to help weed her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire field hands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for sale.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is 53 years old and has eight children between the ages of 8 and 26. He has been selling foodstuffs in a store for 29 years. Fred would like a loan to add more foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, potatoes, and other inventory to his store. He would like to use any profits to pay school fees for his children. Fred would one day like to have a business successful enough to allow him to own a refrigerator and a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou est une femme mariée de 45 ans. Elle habite dans une des localités du Sénégal. Elle est mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 6 et 27 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et depuis 10 ans elle exerce la vente  de glace et d’encens. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par amour, son objectif étant de rechercher des gains financiers. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat  d’encens  à revendre  car c’est un produit très demandé au Sénégal  surtout en cette période de froid qui approche. Elle souhaite accroitre ses bénéfices et contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aissatou lives in Senegal. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 7 children aged between 6 and 27. She is a small retailer and has been selling ice and incense for 10 years. She chose this line of work because she needed to find a way to earn a living and she had an affinity for sales.

Aissatou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since June 2011 and is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs so that she can buy some incense for resale. Incense is particularly in demand in Senegal, especially during the approaching cold season. Aissatou wants to increase her profits and improve her family´s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some incense for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells cassava, gari, and plantains at Besease near Elmina. Efua is married to a farmer and has seven dependents. She has been in this business for 20 years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills. Efua will use her loan to purchase more cassava and gari for sale. With the new profit Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more cassava and gari for sale.

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en:
Nyame is a widow with five dependents. She works as a corn mill operator and also sells saucepans at the village of Besease, near Elmina. She has been into the corn milling business for 15 years. Nyame is responsible for the care of her children.
 She will use her loan to buy spare parts to service her milling machine and also purchase more saucepans for resale. Nyame plans to expand her business with her additional profits.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service her milling machine and also purchase more saucepans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bulk maize for making porridge.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua has been selling maize at the village of Besease, near Elmina, for six years. She is married to a farmer and has three children. Ekua assists her husband in providing for their family. Her loan will be used to purchase bulk maize to sell. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, así como extrovertida y alegre, es conviviente con Carlos, fruto de esa unión tiene dos hermosos hijos de 18 y 4 años de edad, todos instalados cómodamente en una casa que es de su propiedad. El negocio que tiene Elizabeth es la venta de ropa de diferentes marcas y modelos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Por tanto debe viajar a la ciudad de Lima a comprar la mercadería que le solicitan sus clientes, pues ahí donde encontraran a bajo precio dichas prendas. Su estilo de venta es dejar a crédito el producto que vender y cada 20 días realiza la cobranza. 
Lo que le gusta de su actividad son los viajes que realiza, porque se distrae, asimismo las ganancias que percibe de su negocio le ha dado la oportunidad  de comprarse sus artefactos electrodomésticos. No obstante, no le gusta cuando algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en le pago de sus créditos, aún así tiene planes de abrir una tienda donde pueda exhibir su productos, en alguna zona comercial de su ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP, Esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio o trabajo. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de ropas de todas las marcas y modelos en mayor cantidad, así podrá tener un mayor margen de ganancias en esta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 40, is a hard-working and dynamic woman, as well as extroverted and happy.  She lives with Carlos and from this relationship has two beautiful children, ages 18 and 4, all living comfortably in a house that is their property.

Elizabeth's business is selling clothing of various brands and styles for women, men, and children.  For this reason she has to travel to the city of Lima to buy the merchandise that her customers request, since there she will find the clothes at low prices.  Her sales style is to leave the product to sell on credit and collect the payments every 20 days.

What she likes about her work are the trips she makes, because she amuses herself.  She also likes the profits she makes from her business, which has given her the opportunity to buy herself her electrical appliances.  Nevertheless, she does not like when some of her customers get behind on their payments.  Even so, she has plans to open a store where she can display her products, in some commercial area of her city.

This will be her eleventh loan with the MFP institution.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since in that way she will feel secure about moving forward with her business and job.

With the requested amount of 3000 PEN she will invest in buying all brands and styles of clothing wholesale so she will be able to have a greater profit margin in this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 20 years old and single. He owns a small store where he sells cooking oil, sugar, and rice. He has been running this store for one year. He would like a loan to buy more goods to sell in his store. Patrick would like to use any profits from the business to start a banana plantation. He has a dream to own a car sometime in the future.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Vilma Flora

texts.es:
La socia Vilma Flora se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de manjares y yogurt,ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de manjares y yogures.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para hacer yogures como leche,azucar y mantequilla al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vilma Flora continues to work in her business selling caramelized milk products and yogurt. She works independently, taking her products to various places. She works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m. Through this business, the borrower is helping her children get ahead in life. She would like to expand and improve her business selling milk-based sweets and yogurt. The borrower is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make her products, such as milk, sugar and butter, on a wholesale basis. 

The borrower is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make milk-based sweets and yogurt, such as milk, sugar and butter, on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Mary Adela

texts.en: Mary Adela is 33 years old and married with three children aged 1 to 3. Her husband is a soldier. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for three years. Mary would like a loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She would like to use any profits to pay school fees for her children. She dreams to own a big plot of land someday in the future.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Josianne

texts.en: Josianne is 33 years old and has four children between the ages of 1 and 12. Three of her children are currently in school. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She has been running a general store for ten years. Josianne would like a loan to buy more salt, sugar, and rice to sell in her store. The profits will be used to build a house. She dreams to one day own a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs such as salt, sugar, and rice for sale.

loans.name: William Xavier

texts.es: William Xavier se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace mas de 4 años, debido a esta temporada navideña que se acerca el quiere comprar suficiente productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, el objetivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, calzado, bolsos, prenda de plata y oro. A pesar de que muchas veces le resulta difícil ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria.
texts.en: William Xavier has been selling general merchandise for over four years. Due to the approaching Christmas season, he would like to buy sufficient merchandise to offer his customers. The purpose of this loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, shoes, bags, and gold and silver items. Although it has often been difficult, William has succeeded in helping his family to get ahead. The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of necessary materials.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, shoes, bags and gold and silver items

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 43 years old and has six children between the ages of 11 and 23. Three of them currently attend school. She owns a restaurant that she has been running for three years. Immaculee will use the loan to buy milk and baking flour to use in her restaurant. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children and create savings for her future.

loans.use: to buy more milk and baking flour to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La señora Bernarda tiene 63 años de edad y viven en la aldea de Santa Cruz en el municipio de Las Flores. Ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 20 años de edad, los cuales no están estudiando. Los tres aportan económicamente a los gastos del hogar. 

Inició su pulpería en el año 2000 debido a la necesidad de tener un ingreso y un empleo fijo. Utilizó fondos propios y solicitó créditos para surtir el negocio. Bernarda dedica tiempo completo a la pulpería. Vende arroz, manteca, azúcar, frijoles, maíz y refrescos entre otras cosa. 

Solicitó este crédito de L20,000 para surtir su inventario con la compra de frijoles, maíz, azúcar y arroz. Su meta es que el negocio crezca y poder extender la venta de otros productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Bernarda is 63 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Cruz in the town of Las Flores. She is a single mother with two children (ages 19 and 20) who are not in school. The three of them support one another financially with the household expenses.

Bernarda started a grocery store in 2000 because she needed an income and a steady job. Using her own funds and the loans she requested, she was able to stock her business. Bernarda spends her time making sure that her store is complete. She sells rice, lard, sugar, beans, corn, soft drinks, and other products.

Bernarda is requesting a loan of 20,000 HNL to restock her inventory by purchasing beans, corn, sugar, and rice. Her goal is to grow her business so that she can begin selling other products.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Marième Diène

texts.fr: Madame Marième est âgée  d 53 ans et vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 24 et 30ans. Elle s’active dans l’enseignement depuis 1981 comme professeur de français. Mais parallèlement  elle pratique l’activité de commerce depuis plus de 10ans. Son choix du domaine de l’enseignement se justifie  par sa volonté de vouloir s’occuper pour gagner des revenus qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins. Elle  est membre d’un des  guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons à revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de compléter son salaire  afin de  pouvoir couvrir les charges mensuelles de la famille.
texts.en:
Marième lives in Senegal. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of 3 children aged between 24 and 30. She has been a French teacher since 1981 and has also been involved in commerce for over 10 years. She chose to become a teacher because she wanted to earn an income which would allow her to take care of her needs.

Marième has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since July 2011. She is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs so that she can buy fish for resale. She will use her profits to supplement her teaching salary so that she can cover the monthly household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Retina

texts.es:
Retiña, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y sociable, es conviviente con Miguel, fruto de esa unión tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia.
El negocio que realiza Retiña es el comercio de diversos productos como ropa, gaseosas y golosinas. Los cuales compra en la ciudad de Pucallpa, para luego enviarlos por el laderas del rió, al caserío, en donde está instalado su pareja que se dedica a lavado de oro, pero ahí mismo tiene instalado una bodega, donde venden todos los productos que le envía Retiña. Tiene 3 años dedicándose a esta actividad, y gracias a ello tiene solvencia económica, que le permite arreglar su casa, viajar a los caseríos, y ahorrar un capital, pues tiene planes de abrir una tienda de venta de golosinas en alguna zona comercial céntrica de la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con  el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como gaseosas y ropa, así como también productos para la campaña navideña como panteones, arbolitos artificiales de navidad y otros.
texts.en:
Retiña, who is 27 years old, is a hardworking woman, as well as being cheerful and sociable. She lives with Miguel, and they have a 10 year old daughter together. They all live comfortably in their own home.

Retiña runs a business selling various products such as clothes, fizzy drinks and sweets. She buys these in the city of Pucallpa. She then sends them along the banks of the river to the village where her partner is based, who works washing gold. There they have a storeroom set up, where they sell the products that Retiña sends over. They have dedicated themselves to this for three years, thanks to which they are economically solvent. This enables them to keep their house in good repair, to travel to the villages and to save some money, since they have plans to open a sweet shop in a commercial area of the city center. 

This will be Retiña's second loan with the MFP institution, and she is hoping for a small loan so she can fulfill her goals. She is committed to meeting the repayments, as she was with the previous loan. Furthermore, she feels comfortable with her communal bank, since she considers its members to be responsable and united. She will invest the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles in buying merchandise, such as fizzy drinks and clothes, as well as products for the Christmas period such as panettone bread and artificial Christmas trees, amongst other things.

loans.use: to buy clothes, fizzy drinks, panettone bread and artificial Christmas trees.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre is 26 years old and single. He runs a hair salon which he has owned for two years. He would like a loan to buy more razors for his salon.  Jean Pierre would like to use any profits to build a house and create savings. He hopes to see his business expand and prosper.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment for use in his salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more clothes and slippers for sale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 51 years old and has nine children between the ages of 8 and 32. She sells cassava in a store she has run for 30 years. She would like a loan to buy a plantation of cassava to sell in her shop. Any profits will be used to provide for her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cassava for sale.

loans.name: Calixte

texts.en: Callixte is 30 years old with three children between the ages of 3 and 7. He sells different items in his store which he has run for five years. He would like a loan to buy rice, maize flour, beans, potatoes, cooking oil, and sugar to sell in his store. Callixte would like to use any profits to create savings and provide for his family. He would love to own a warehouse for his inventory in the future.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en: Evariste is 50 years old and has nine children who range in age from 3 to 22. All of them are in school. He earns a living by selling charcoal in a shop he has run for the last 25 years. He is applying for this loan to buy more sand and stones to make into bricks to sell to his customers. Evariste plans to use the profits made possible by this loan to plant trees which he will use in the future. His goal is to double his profit in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy sand and stones to make into bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more fruit and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en: Damascene is 43 years old and has five children between the ages of 17 and 23. He has been selling goats for 20 years. He would like a loan to buy more goats to sell. Damascene will use any profits to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children. He dreams to one day sell cows.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale

loans.name: Gerturde

texts.en: Gerturde is 41 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 15 and 22. She sells items such as salt, sugar, and cooking oil in a store she has run for ten years. Gerturde would like a loan to buy more salt, sugar,cooking oil and other new items to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To add more items in his store such as salt, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Callixte

texts.en: Callixte is 43 years old and has four children between the ages of 2 and 10. He runs a general store which he has owned for seven years. Callixte would like a loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, and other foodstuffs to sell in his store. He plans to use any profits to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Protogene

texts.en: Protegene is 41 years old and has 3 children ages 6 to 15. All of his children are currently in school. He sells clothes in a store that he has run for 8 years. Protegene would like a loan to buy more clothes to stock his shop. He will use any profits to pay school fees for his children. He dreams to one day become a distributor for used clothing.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice and maize in bulk for food preparation and sale.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 53 years old and has seven children who range in age from 12 to 35. She is a widow who earns a living by running a general store. She is applying for this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans and sorghum to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits made possible by this loan to renovate her house and pay her children's school fees. She dreams of one day owning a large, successful store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 28 years old and married with three children between the ages of 1 and 12. She sells cassava in a shop she has run for seven years. Jacqueline would like a loan to buy more cassava, rice, and sorghum to sell in her store. She plans to use any profits to pay school fees for her children and create savings.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, rice, and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 67 years old and has three children. She sells cassava in a shop she has run for four years. She would like to buy more cassava to sell in her store and also add new products such as beans and sorghum. Consolee will use any profits to create savings and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more cassava for sale.

loans.name: Epipahnie

texts.en: Epipahnie is 36 years old and has two children aged 7 and 9. Both kids are in school. She sells cassava in a store she has run for twelve years. Epipahnie would like a loan to increase her inventory of cassava. Any profits will be used to make savings for her future. She dreams to have a big and prosperous store.

loans.use: to buy more cassava for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua  is a widow and sells "banku" (maize dumplings) and saucepans at Besease near Elmina.  She has been in this business for the past 15 years now. She has three children. Ekua is responsible for the upkeep of her children. She will use her loan to purchase more saucepans and maize for sale.  She plans to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 41 years old and married with four children between the ages of 5 and 12. All of the children are in school. She sells cassava in a store she has run for 25 years. Jean would like a loan to buy more cassava and new products such as rice, sugar, sorghum, and cooking oil. Any profits will be used to create savings for her family. She hopes to diversify the items in her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy cassava, sugar, rice, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Oulèye

texts.fr: Madame Oulèye est une femme mariée. Elle habite au Sénégal. Elle est  âgée  de 32 ans. Elle est mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre un et huit ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et vend de l’huile de palme depuis plus de 5 ans. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion mais dan le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est sociétaire dans un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2008. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’huile de palme destiné a renforcer son activité de commerce. Son intention est d’augmenter ses profits pour mieux contribuer  a l’amélioration des conditions d vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oulèye lives in Senegal. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of 3 children aged between 1 and 8. She is involved in commerce and has been selling palm oil for over 5 years. She chose this line of work because she had an affinity for it and she needed to earn a living.

Oulèye has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since July 2008 and is requesting a loan of 75 000 francs so that she can restock on palm oil for resale. She would like to increase her profits so that she can contribute more towards improving her family´s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells slippers, bananas and plantains at Besease near Elmina. She has been selling these items for seven years. Abena is married to a farmer and has five dependents. Abena uses her income to help her husband provide for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more slippers to sell. With the profit, Abena plans to acquire a shop in which to sell her slippers

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace mas de 8 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella siempre ha sido una persona responsable y que disfruta de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Ella inicio por medio de sus hijas buscando un medio de vida para sufragar los gastos del hogar, ella sale a vender todos los días de manera ambulante, con el propósito de lograr mejorar la condición económica de su familia. El crédito es para la compra de bolsos, cremas, calzado, prendas de oro laminado, plata y ropa en general.
texts.en: Rosa María sells general merchandise. This has been her livelihood for over 8 years. She has always been a responsible person who enjoys providing her family with the income it needs. For the sake of her daughters, she started looking for a job to defray their household expenses. Now Rosa goes out every day, selling in an ambulatory manner, in order to improve her family's economic condition. This loan is to buy bags, creams, shoes, gold-plated and silver items, and clothing in general.

loans.use: to buy bags, creams, shoes, gold-plated and silver items, and clothing

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader at Besease near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has five children. She has been in business for the past eight years. Esi uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Faailo

texts.en:
Faailo is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Gataivai. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Faailo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Faailo has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1000 Samoa Tala (WST) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Faailo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faailo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Faailo is now requesting a new loan of 1450 WST which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozone. The loan will be the second loan taken out by Faailo from SPBD. Faailo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

Dear KIVA fellows, please note that the dates in the clients photo are wrong because it was a mistake made by our Loan Officers for not resetting the time, date and year of the camera but the picture was taken within this month. I hope this won't happen again in the coming future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozone.

loans.name: Lucien Sèmawon

texts.fr: Lucien Sèmawon est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Lucien Sèmawon est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Honorine. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Lucien Sèmawon exerce depuis une dizaine d’années le métier d’ajustage. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent cette activité, Lucien Sèmawon contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Lucien Sèmawon sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Lucien Sèmawon a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Lucien Sèmawon is 32 years old and lives in Benin.  Lucien Sèmawon is married to a reseller named Honorine.  Together they have three children whom they financially support.  Some of their children go to school and all live with their parents.  Lucien and Honorine take care of the household together.  In order to support himself and his family, Lucien Sèmawon has been working as a metal worker for about ten years.  With his income, Lucien Sèmawon helps meet his family's various expenses.  Because the number of his customers is increasing, Lucien Sèmawon is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  His previous loan was well reimbursed.

loans.use: To buy metal pieces (iron rods etc...) for metalwork.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Gataivai. She is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Eseta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Eseta has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 Somoa Tala (WST) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eseta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Eseta is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones. The loan will be the second loan taken out by Eseta from SPBD. Eseta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Dear KIVA lenders, please take note that the dates in the client photo are wrong, it was totally a mistake made by our Loan Officers for not resetting the time, date and year of the camera, but the photos were taken within this month. I hope this won't happen again in the coming future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones.

loans.name: Kounouho Sondé

texts.fr: Kounouho Sondé est âgé de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Kounouho Sondé est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Claudine. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Kounouho Sondé exerce depuis dix huit ans le métier d’ajusteur. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Kounouho Sondé contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Kounouho Sondé sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Kounouho Sondé a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Kounouho Sondé is 34 years old and lives in Bénin. Kounouho Sondé is married to a hair stylist named Claudine. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school, and all of whom are under their care. In addition to their children, the couple has another child in their care. The children live together with their parents. The couple take care of the household expenses together. To meet his needs and those of his children, Kounouho Sondé has been doing metal work for eighteen years. Thanks for the revenue he makes from this, Kounouho Sondé contributes to his family’s different expenses. In order to satisfy the needs of his continually growing clientele, Kounouho Sondé is seeking his second loan from ALIDé. Kounouho Sondé’s previous loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy tools for metal work

loans.name: Kueni

texts.en:
Kueni is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Pitonuu Satupaitea.  She is married and does not have any children. To make a living, Kueni plants and harvests yams for sale. Kueni has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,200 Samoa Tala (WST) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Kueni joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kueni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  

Kueni is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers, seedlings and gromozone (an herbicide). This will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  

Kueni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

Please note that the dates in the photos are wrong because of the mistake made by our Loan Officers for not resetting the dates and year of the camera. I hope this won't happen again.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers, seedlings and gromozone (an herbicide).

loans.name: Sala

texts.fr: Madame Sala est une femme marée de 45 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 2 enfants de 5 et 14 ans.  Elle était restauratrice auparavant  mais  depuis 20 ans elle pratique la vente de voiles et de lampes torches, ainsi que d’autres objets divers. Elle a choisi cette activité par passion et s’intéresse  plutôt a l’argent qu’elle gagne. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2007. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de voiles et d’autres objets divers qu’elle va revendre a sa clientèle. Elle envisage renforcer son activité de commerce et  accroitre ses bénéfices pour  mieux contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sala lives in Senegal. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 2 children aged 5 and 14 years old. She was originally a restaurateur, but for the past 20 years has been selling diverse products such as veils and torches. She has an affinity for sales and likes running a profitable business.

She has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since November 2007 and is requesting a loan of 50 000 francs so that she can buy veils and other items to resell to her customers. She plans on strengthening her business and increasing her profits, which she will use to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy veils and other items for resale.

loans.name: Norma Noemi's Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma Noemi, tiene 30 años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos menores D. edad, ellos son su motor para trabajar y lograr brindarles lo necesario para vivir tranquilos.
Ella tiene una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, desD. muy joven inició su negocio, llegó D. provincia a una zona que recien empezaba a poblarse, por lo que para que surja su negocio, para que cresca le costó mucho trabajo, pero gracias a su sacrificio y empeño a lograr sus metas hoy en día cuenta con casa propia y tiene otro terreno aparte.
Su próxima meta es poner una ferretería y aprovechar en usar el terreno vacío que tiene, opina que éste negocio le sería muy provechoso puesto que vive en una zona que recién está poblándose y muchos vecinos están empezando a cosntruir sus casas.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes y bebeidas para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Norma Noemi is 30 years old and has two young children.  They are her engines for working and bringing them what they need to live happily.

She has a store located in her home.  She started this business when she was very young.  She came from the province to a zone that was just beginning to populate.  It was a lot of work for her to grow her business, but thanks to her hard work and sacrifice, she was able to achieve her goals and now has a home of her own.  She also has another plot of land.

Her next goal is to open a hardware store and take advantage of the empty land she has.  She feels that this business will be very beneficial because she lives in a zone that is just populating and many of her neighbors are beginning to build their homes.

She will use the money from this loan to invest in groceries and drinks to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Leuma

texts.en:
Leuma is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Maota.  She is married and has six school-aged children.  To make a living, Leuma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, growing crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Leuma has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Leuma joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Leuma  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Leuma  is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Leuma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her agriculture business.

loans.name: Giannina

texts.es: Giannina, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de alegre y comunicativa, es soltera, vive en compañía de su madre, padre y  su hermano de 25 años de edad, cómodamente instalados en la casa de sus padres. Giannina, es profesional en enfermería, trabajando  en un centro de salud, pero viendo que sus ingresos no le alcanzan, dedicidio incursionar en el negocio de venta de ropa femenina, para eso cuenta con el apoyo de una tía que vive en la ciudad de Lima, que es quien le envía la ropa que será vendida a sus cliente por medio de pedidos. Lo que le gusta de esa actividad es que le generará un ingreso económico extra para sus gastos personales, así como distraerla y socializar con sus colegas y amistades. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta de esa actividad sería la impuntualidad del pago de los créditos otorgados, pero eso no la desanima y piensa en buscar clientes responsables que le garanticen el pago de sus compras. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa femenina en variados modelos y al por mayor, para así tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en: Giannina, 28, is a working woman who is determined, as well as cheerful and communicative.  She is single and lives comfortably with her mother, father and brother, 25 years old, in her parents’ home. Giannina is a nurse practitioner, working in a health center, but seeing that her income was not enough, decided to break in to the business of selling women's clothing. For this, she has the support of an aunt who lives in Lima, who is the one who sent the clothes to be sold to her customer through orders. What she likes about this activity is that it will generate extra income for personal expenses, distract her and socialize with colleagues and friends. On the other hand, what she does not like about this activity would be the lateness of the payment of credits granted, but that does not discourage her and she plans to look for responsible customers that will guarantee payment for their purchases. This will be the loan number 2 with the institution MFP therefore she hopes the small loan with meet her goals. On the other hand, she is committed to being punctual with the repayment of fees as in the previous loan. With the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying women's clothing in various models, wholesale, so to have a higher profit margin.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Siiae

texts.en:
Siiae is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Samata Uta. She is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Siiae owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Siiae has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 Samoa Tala (WST) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Siiae joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Siiae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Siiae is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. This will be the second loan taken out by Siiae from SPBD. Siiae plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

Please note that the dates in the photos taken are wrong because it was a mistake made by our Loan Officers for not resetting the dates and years of the camera. I hope this won't happen again.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads.

loans.name: Alvaro De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Álvaro a sus 42 años de edad es padre de dos hijos, se dedica a la conducción de un vehículo que es propiedad de su esposa. En el vehículo, el señor Álvaro transporta flores, mercancía, acarreos, viajes entre otros servicios entre veredas o la zona urbana del municipio del Carmen de Viboral localizado al oriente de Antioquia. El señor Álvaro requiere de la reparación del motor del vehículo, con lo cual podrá mejorar la calidad de su servicio y podrá recibir mayores ingresos y de esta manera puede disfrutar con su familia. El sueño del señor Álvaro es brindarles bienestar y oportunidades de crecimiento a su familia e hijos.
texts.en:
Álvaro, 42, is the father of two children.  He works driving a vehicle that belongs to his wife.  In the vehicle, Álvaro transports flowers, merchandise, contracted hauling and trips among other services along the back roads or in the urban zone of the town of Carmen de Viboral located in eastern Antioquia.  

Álvaro needs to repair the vehicle’s engine so that he can improve service and earn higher income to enjoy with his family.  Álvaro’s dream is to provide wellbeing and opportunities for growth to his family and children.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle's engine.

loans.name: Inès Juliette

texts.fr: Inès Juliette est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Inès Juliette est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Martin. Le couple a deux enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Inès Julienne exerce depuis six ans le métier de coiffure à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Inès Juliette vend des céréales et de divers articles (savons et charbons) par le système de distribution. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère ces activités, Inès Julienne contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Inès Julienne sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement par Inès Julienne ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Inès Juliette is 29 years old and lives in Benin. Inès Juliette is married to a teacher named Martin. The couple has two educated, dependent children. In addition to their own children, the couple also cares for another child. The children live together with their parents. The couple covers the various household expenses together.

To contribute to the various needs of the family, Inès Juliette has been working as a hairdresser out of her own home for six years now. On the side, Inès Juliette sells cereal and various items (soap and coal) by the distribution system. Thanks to the revenue that she generates from this work, Inès Juliette contributes to the family's various expenses.

To meet the needs of her growing customer base, Inès Juliette is asking for a fourth loan through ALIDé. Her three previous loans were all paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap and bags of coal.

loans.name: Francisca Adjoa

texts.en: Francisca Adjoa sells doughnuts at Besease near Elmina.  She has been selling doughnuts for 12 years.  Francisca Adjoa is a single parent and has three children.  She is responsible for raising her children. She will use this loan to buy flour and sugar. She hopes to use the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mondoukpè Rachelle

texts.fr: Mondoukpè Rachelle est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Mondoukpè Rachelle est mariée à un fonctionnaire du nom de Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Mondoukpè Rachelle vend depuis quatre ans des articles de la plomberie (tuyaux, pointes, tôles et pots de colles). De façon secondaire, Mondoukpè Rachelle vend des charbons et de divers articles. Grâce aux revenus que lui génèrent ces activités, Mondoukpè Rachelle contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Mondoukpè Rachelle sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement par Mondoukpè Rachelle ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Mondoukpè Rachelle is 34 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to Joseph, a civil servant.  The couple has four dependent children; all are in school.  The children live together with their parents.  The couple takes care of the various household expenses together.  In order to provide for the family, Mondoukpè Rachelle has been selling plumbing materials (pipe, cutters, sheet metal, and pots of glue).  She also sells coal and various articles on the side.  Thanks to the revenue that this business generates, she pays her share of the household expenses.  To satisfy the demands of her growing clientele, Mondoukpè Rachelle is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.  The three loans that she previously received have been fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy plumbing materials (pipe, cutters, sheet metal, and pots of glue)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, salt, soda, and lard.

loans.name: Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne

texts.fr: Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Emmanuel. Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. En plus de leur enfant, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des charbons et des savons par le système de distribution. Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne s'approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne is 38 years old and lives in Benin. Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne is married to a driver named Emmanuel. Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne has a primary school education. The couple has one dependent child who is in school. In addition to their own child, the couple also cares for another child. The children live together with their parents. The couple covers the various household expenses together.

To meet her needs and the needs to her children, Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne has been selling coal and soap by the distribution system for about ten years now. Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne buys the coal and soap in Benin and in Togo. Thanks to the revenue that she earns from this work, Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne contributes to the various expenses of her family.

In order to meet the needs of her growing customer base, Gimadé Marguerite Evelyne is seeking a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap and bags of coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, melons and mangoes.

loans.name: Pierrette Akouavi

texts.fr: Pierrette Akouavi est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Pierrette Akouavi est mariée à un enseignant du nom de François. Pierrette Akouavi a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Pierrette Akouavi vend depuis vingt ans de divers articles et des céréales (maïs, riz, haricot et farine de manioc). Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Pierrette Akouavi contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Pierrette Akouavi sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Pierrette Akouavi ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Pierrette Akouavi is 52 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a teacher named François. She dropped out of middle school. The couple has three children in school to support. In addition to their children, they have three other children to support. The children live together with their parents. The couple jointly ensures that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To support herself and her children, Pierrette Akouavi has been selling a variety of goods and grains (corn, rice, beans, and cassava flour) for twenty years. Thanks to the income this business generates for her, she is helping with the family expenses. 

To satisfy the needs of her burgeoning customer base, Pierrette Akouavi is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a fourth time. The loans she previously received have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, rice, beans and cassava flour

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells rice porridge at Besease near Elmina. Mary is married to a farmer and has three children.  She has been selling porridge for eight years.  She uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills. Mary will use this loan to purchase rice for the preparation of the porridge. With the profit, Mary will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice to prepare porridge.

loans.name: Bodunrin Germaine

texts.fr: Bodunrin Germaine est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Bodunrin Germaine est mariée à un électricien du nom de Alain. Bodunrin Germaine a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Bodunrin Germaine exerce depuis onze ans le métier de couture dans son quartier.
