A member of PMPC for seven years, she has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase flour as a primary ingredient of her snack-vending business. In the future, Nora hopes to have her own refreshment business in the area.

loans.use: to purchase flour as a primary ingredient of her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Narangarav

texts.en:
Narangarav is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her family in outer ger district without the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She has three children, ages 4 months to 14 years, and her elder two children attend local secondary school.

Narangarav has been working at a pet shop since 2009, and currently she looks after her newborn baby. Her husband works as a machinist at a local company. The family lives in an old small house, in which they have been doing some renovation work. They haven’t finished their renovation work yet; today Narangarav needs some bricks, wood, and other essential materials to finish her housing work. Therefore, she is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian Tughrik (MNT) loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 47 years old and lives in Alegria, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 

Cresencia has a banana sales business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase 10 baskets of bananas to sell. 

Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Cresencia hopes to earn more income from her business to spend on her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase 10 baskets of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Reymunda

texts.en:
Reymunda is married with four children.  She is 46 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.

Reymunda is a farmer and engages in a backyard piggery business to earn a living.  She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and medicines for her pig-raising business.

Reymunda has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Reymunda hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicines for her piggery business.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente operates a transportation business in his local community. He has been doing this for the past five years, and earns 10,000 PHP each month. Vicente has been a member of GDMPC for a year.

Vicente is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. In the future, he hopes that his children will finish their studies and that his business income will double.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna works hard to support her family. She is married and sells "balut" (fertilized duck eggs) in the Philippines.

Digna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more "balut" to sell. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Digna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more "balut" to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 40 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shamer

texts.en: Shamer is 49 years old and lives with her husband and son in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Bayn-Ulgii province, Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed and her son is a school student. She started her garment retailing business in 2000 by renting a counter in a market. Her business is increasing steadily however her income is not quite enough to support her family since she's the only breadwinner, therefore, she has rented another counter. Now, her supplies are not enough to fill another whole counter. She is requesting 3,700,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My son will attend college next year, therefore I need to act aggressively to increase my income."

loans.use: To buy stock for her new garment sales counter.

loans.name: Geogette

texts.en:
Geogette is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Geogette is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Geogette has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Geogette requested a 14,000 Philippines pesos loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Geogette has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Geogette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
This is Felicisima, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a single parent with three children currently studying in elementary school.  She keeps herself busy attending to her kids and business. She wants to provide a comfortable life for her family. 

Felicisima maintains a direct selling business. She sells herbal supplements. Her customers' orders are bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer on a cash basis. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community who prefer taking herbal medicines to cure their ailments.  She earns a minimum of Php550 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 31,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy herbal supplement orders for her customers. The herbal supplements that she carries produce good results for her clients and they recommend them to friends who they believe need them, too. To date, she has received plenty of orders and she needs additional capital. 

Felicisima dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She aspires to attain a good position in her direct selling business and to be able to have a kiosk someday where she can display her herbal supplement items.  She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to share her own story of God’s love and provision in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for herbal supplement products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell crafts business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafts business.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafts business.

loans.name: Phom

texts.en:
Phom is a 25 year old garment factory worker (husband shown) in Kompong Speu province.  Her work schedule runs from 7am to 5pm, and usually includes a one-hour lunch break.  Sometimes she works overtime in order to make more money.  Typically Phom earns approximately $60 per month. 

She lives with her husband and three school-aged children. 

With the sums of $1,100 from HKL, Phom will expand and repair her house.  Her house is old and too narrow. 

Phom said she and her husband will try harder to earn more income to ensure a brighter future for her children.  Phom is a conservative woman, so her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to expand and fix her house.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old, married and has four school-aged children.

To make a living, Ramil owns and operates a tricycle. passenger transport service.  Ramil has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Ramil is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, to pay for the cost to maintenance and repair his motorcycle tricycle.

In 2010, Ramil joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve his business and living situation.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for the cost to maintenance and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Berdimurat

texts.en: Berdimurat is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and their two sons are school students. He started his business in 2006 by purchasing truck to do transport. Now that the construction business is booming in town, he wants to buy another truck. He is a sharp and diligent man who says, "This summer, my income was doubled and this is just a start. I wish to increase more, so my family will live happily, finally." He is short the amount of 3,000,000 MNT to buy a truck.

loans.use: To buy another truck.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 26 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, drinks, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like  shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie is 27 years old, single and from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Freddie provides transportation services to local community member to earn a living.  He has been in business for three years and earn 7,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Freddie joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Freddie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to pay the cost to maintenance and repair his motorcycle. 

Freddie hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay the cost to maintenance and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
This is Soledad, 37, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Enrico, 44, a driver, and mother to four children. Three of them go to school.  While attending to her kids, she also keeps herself busy attending to her business. Her income helps the family in covering daily expenses. 

Soledad owns a small-scale retail business. She buys perfumes, dresses, and shoes and displays them in her store.  She earns money by getting the items at a lower price and selling them a little bit higher in order to have her capital back. She’s also into direct selling business for Natasha, Avon, and Barley. Since her stall is located in an urban area, it is easy for her to have regular sales especially from mothers who pass by her store. She earns a minimum of 550 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more merchandise items and products that she will display in her stall in order to attract more customers. The more items displayed at the store the better. She will gain income and have better profits. She saves the profit for emergencies and her children’s expenses in school. 

Soledad hopes that her business will last and continue to help her in meeting family needs. She wants all her children to finish their studies and fulfill their own dreams and aspirations in life. She wants them to have a comfortable life. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as she strongly believes that as a Christian we must have quality time devoted to our Creator. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is married with one child. Arsenia is 54 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Arsenia sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase flour and sugar for her snack vending business.

Arsenia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Arsenia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour and sugar for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Rosalie has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Primitiva requested a loan of 19,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Primitiva would like to renovate her house and expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 65 years old and married with seven children. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, feeds, canned goods and other groceries. 

Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Teofela

texts.en:
Teofela is married with seven children. Teofila is 69 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Teofela is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide, and to pay for the labor.

Teofela has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Teofela hopes to have a good harvest for her family's future .

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

location.town: Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 34 years old and married with two children.

Corazon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Corazon has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and also earns income from rice retailing.

Corazon aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 61 years old and married with nine children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Thelma aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Savun

texts.en: Savun, 31, resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Savun sells groceries, and her husband buys cows to resell to cover the family's expenses. Savun is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
This is Digna, 52, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow and is solely responsible for her three children, one in college and two in high school. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to meet their daily needs and expenses

Digna owns a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like copper, plastic, paper, etc. They sell these to junk shops like Digna’s for a little profit. A junk shop then stacks, cleans, and gathers huge quantities of these materials to sell them back to factories or to a bigger junk shop.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in her daily sales.

Digna is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 that will help to continue her business well.  She will use the loan to buy more recyclable materials from scavengers. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses.  

Digna dreams that her junk shop will last and continue to grow. She wants her children to finish their studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it helps her to be stronger and closer to God with all the Bible studies being conducted. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is married with two children. Eufemia is 43 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Eufemia owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 6000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase stock for her general store.

Eufemia has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Eufemia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 60 years old and married with three children.

Salvacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Salvacion has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling meat and vegetables.

Salvacion aspires to save enough money to build a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Evangeline has been in this business for 20 years. Evangeline earns more income from rice retailing.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger(mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a chauffeur, her son (who lives with her) is a school student and her other three children are employed and live independently. 

She started her foodcourt business in 2010 by renting a space in the market. Now that her kids are grown, she wants to expand her business by purchasing equipment worth 500,000 MNT. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I had no chance to expand my business when my children were young and I had to support them. Now that they are grown and independent, I will concentrate on my business".

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 35 years old and lives in Purok2 Carangan, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 1 child. Gilda has a carenderia and boarding house business and earns approximately PHP 30,000.00 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan of PHP 50000 to purchase materials for her boarding house renovation. 

Gilda has been a member of PMPC for 2 months. In the future, Gilda hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her boarding house renovation.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Susan is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,655 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Susan is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2007, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en: Eoun, 60, resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She sells fried chickens and mangoes. The family is also assisted by her two children, currently employed at the garment factory. Eoun is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Orhonbaatar

texts.en:
Orhonbaatar is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger(Mongolian yurt) in Bulgan province, Mongolia. His wife runs a garment retailing business, his eldest kid is a school student and the younger one goes to kindergarten. 

Orhonbaatar started his taxi service business in earlier this year. His business is going well, however, he needs winter tires and his wife needs winter supplies, therefore, he is requesting 1,500,000 MNT. He's family's income is increasing, however now that winter is here, his and his wife's business is slowing down.

loans.use: to buy a winter tires for taxi and supplies for garment business.

loans.name: Melfa

texts.en:
Melfa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut wine and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional coconut wine and vegetables to sell.

Melfa has been in this business for 13 years.

Melfa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconut wine and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is married with three children. He is 60 years old and resides in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Antonio is operating a livestock business, raising pigs for sale to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years. Each month, he earns 5,000 Philippine pesos doing this type of work.

He requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Antonio has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Antonio wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Baasan

texts.en: Baasan is 57 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is retired and her two kids have both graduated college and are employed. She started this commodity retail business in 2000 by renting a counter in the market. Her business is stable and she is a respected businesswoman in the market. Now that her kids grown and independent, she's concentrating on her business by renting another counter in the market. However her stock is not enough to run another counter. Therefore, she's requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy supplies. She's a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Over the years I never had an opportunity to expand my business- now that I have, I don't want to lose my opportunity."

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Milman

texts.en:
Milman is a 33-year-old married man with 1 child who lives in the Philippines. To earn a living, Milman operates a service-based business providing transportation to local community members. He has been doing this for 5 years and he earns PHP 15,000 a month. 

Milman has requested a loan of PHP 45,000 to make repairs on his existing vehicle so he can better service his customers.

Milman has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to finish education of his child and to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to make repairs on his existing vehicle.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is married with three children. She is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion, Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur.

Vicenta has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Vicenta has been a member of Paglaum MPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married with three children. Merlyn is 31 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Merlyn has a shell craft business. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase shells for her craft business. Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for four years.

In the future, Merlyn hopes to have savings for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase shells for her craft business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 25 years old and single.  He resides in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Stephen is operating a livestock business, raising pigs for sale to earn a living. He has been in this business for 3 years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business.

Stephen requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. He has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Munkh-Erdene

texts.en:
Munkh-Erdene is a 35-year-old entrepreneur who supports his family by operating a fuel/firewood selling business at the largest outdoor wood market in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He lives with his wife in the outer ger district without the basic infrastructure of the city. 

Munkh-Erdene’s wife helps to him operate his business.  Both of them are very experienced in this business. In winter Mongolia is very cold and that kind of business is becoming popular, so they want to purchase more fuel/firewood to sell. 

Currently, Munkh-Erdene has an old small truck, but that truck's capacity is too small, so he needs a new one. With this 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan, he wants to buy a truck to carry his fuel/firewood.

loans.use: buy a new truck to carry fuel/firewood

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 47 years old and lives in Paglaum Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two sons.

Zosima has a clothing business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase used clothes for her used clothing business.

Zosima has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Zosima hopes to open her own shop to display for her RTW (Ready to Wear) products.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Marilyn has a business selling viands. She earns about 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Marilyn has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more ingredients for her viand vending business.

Marilyn has joined PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Marilyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her viands

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is 36 years of age and married with three children.  He has grown rice for 10 years and he usually earns P22,000 for every crop.  

Salvador is a responsible father who's willing to do everything possible to lift his family from poor living conditions.  His wife’s name is Maribel.  She raises hogs and helps Salvador cultivate their rice field.

At this moment, Salvador wants to obtain a loan of P50,000 to buy farm input such as fertilizers, rice seedlings and to pay labor costs for planting. 

Salvador hopes the loan will lead to a greater rice harvest so he can better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm input such as fertilizers, rice seedlings and to pay labor costs for planting.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok, 32-year-old married woman and the mother of three single children, is a skillful potter. From this business, she is able to make a profit of $1.50 a day to try and support her family. She is married to Mr. Sim, 39, who is in the business of collecting and selling firewood. He earns $2.50 each day. 

Currently Mrs. Sok is concerned about her mother's funeral because she doesn’t have enough money for it. So she decided to ask for some funds from Kiva and HKL to buy necessary things for the funeral and to pay for the whole ceremony. She would like to say thanks to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to buy necessary things for the funeral and pay for the whole ceremony.

loans.name: Illuminada

texts.en:
Illuminada is married with three children. Illuminada is 29 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Illuminada has a spices retail business to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase different spices to sell/retail.

Illuminada has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Illuminada hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Laywi

texts.en: Laywi is 54 years old. He is married and has four children. They live in Naganacan, where he manages his one-hectare family rice field. He has been farming for 20 years. He received just PHP 11,000 from his last crop because of an unexpected typhoon. Therefore, Laywi is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm. He hopes that he can get the amount he has requested, and he promises to repay the loan on time. He believes that this loan will be of enormous help for increasing his yield.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rubina Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rubina Bibi is married with four children. Her eldest son is a mason, the second one is involved in a leather business, and her youngest son is in the 7th grade. She has one daughter who is also studying. 

Rubina and her husband are very hard-working by nature. They both work so that they can help each other financially. Rubina owns and operates a sewing business from her home. She collects orders from community clients and from her relatives. Her fees are based on the work she is asked to do, and her clients don’t argue about the costs because they receive quality and timely work from her. Her husband works for a private organization. He works nine hours per day for a monthly wage.

Rubina is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She intends to use the loan to purchase a new sewing machine and unstitched clothes, which she will then sew and sell to her customers. This is the season of marriages, so with a new sewing machine and clothes in bulk quantity, she expects to have good sales and increase her revenue.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Rubina Bibi.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and unstitched clothes.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married to Richard, and she is the mother of two children. She is 30 years old and lives Nazareth, Buenavista, Pagadian City, Philippines.

For the past five years, she has earned her living by raising hogs. Marissa has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase feed, vitamins, and pigs for her hog-raising business. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she runs a general store where she sells a variety of food and home-use products in the local community, such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many others. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,600 PHP a month.

Evelyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2007, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina is 63 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children. 

Ursulina has a tailoring business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase new materials for her tailoring shop. . 

Ursulina has been a member of PMPC for 25 years. In the future, Ursulina hopes to have number of tailoring shops in town and hopes to have her own dress shop someday.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en: Clemente has been a rice farmer for fifteen years, and he usually earns PHP 26,000 per season. He is willing to work hard every single day to lift his family out of poverty. Clemente is married to Marcelina, who helps him manage their family rice field. He says that the income generated from his business has enabled him to provide for their household. He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain his rice production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested in order to support further growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is married with two children. Margie is 34 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Margie sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase flour, sugar and bananas.

Margie has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Margie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and bananas

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 49-year-old widow with three school-age children. Her husband died of severe hypertension. He didn't go to a good hospital because of their financial difficulties. As a result, she has to run the family's farming business in order to provide a living for her three children. Despite the difficulties of farming, she is brave enough to face whatever difficulties she encounters. For her, the most important thing is to provide for her children.

To be able to provide for the family's necessities, she needs financial assistance. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor in her corn field. She knows that abundant crops will allow her to lift her family out of poverty and give them a better standard of living.  

She says "Just believe in our Almighty God and definitely, He will help you with any burden".

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor in her corn field.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children and she is 39 years old.  She resides at Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, The Philippines.

Josephine operates a livestock rearing business, raising pigs to sell in order to earn a living.  She has been five years in this business.  Each month she earns PHP 15,000 doing this business.

She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Josephine has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Josephine wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies for her pig business.

loans.name: Doleta

texts.en:
Doleta is married with five children. Doleta is 63 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Doleta is a teacher and she sells materials for teaching aids to earn a living. This is her new business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase materials for teaching aids to sell/retail.

Doleta joined PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Doleta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for teaching aids to sell/retail

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga owns a 2-rooms apartment which is built early in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He works as a accountant in a private food company and lives with his wife and son. 

Gantulga always thinks about renovating and making improvements to his apartment because it has become very old and is damaged everywhere. Last September, he started the renovation of his apartment, but he could not finish it due to lack of money to purchase the necessary building materials. The loan he is taking out will be used to purchase the building materials needed to complete the renovation of his apartment.

loans.use: renovate his apartment

loans.name: Marcela Group

texts.en:
Marcela is 52 years old and lives in Trigos, Ozamiz City. She is widowed with one school-aged and six adult-aged children. 

To earn a living, Marcela has a business selling snacks like hot cakes. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Marcela has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc.

Marcela has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Marcela would like to expand her business in the neighboring area of Ozamiz.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc,

loans.name: Filomena  Group

texts.en: Filomena is 46 years old, and lives in Colupan Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.  Filomena has a shop that sells rice grains. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 21,000  to purchase additional rice grains for sale. Filomena has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Filomena hopes to send her children to school. Filomena is the leader of a three person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice grains for sale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with two children. Fe is 43 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Fe sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase new clothes to sell.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Fe hopes to have her own dress shop in the area.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru: Абдурашит житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Abdurashit lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 36 years old, married, and has four children. He provides a taxi service. He has a wealth of experience in this field. He is taking out a loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her brother’s business who lives with her and operates a tailoring business.  With the loan investment, he will buy a new sewing machine and also hire a worker who will help him in completing the orders on time.

Shumaila also sews clothes. She is an expert in ladies' clothing and knows about the latest trends and fashion about clothing. This helps her prepare beautiful looking clothes and satisfy her clients.  Her husband is a blacksmith and makes iron products. He is an expert in his work and earns reasonably good profits every month.

Shumaila is the mother of 2 children. Both of them are very young and not of school-going age yet.   Her brother is married and Shumaila is hopeful that after the loan investment, he will be able to run his business better and his family will be able to have a better financial life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Аъзамчон житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Аъзамчон занимается развозкой пассажиров по городу. Он в этой области уже шесть лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Azamjon lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 35 years old, married, and has two children. His children are in high school. Azamjon works driving passengers around the city. He has been doing this work for six years. He is taking out a loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 43 years old.  He is engaged in a farming business as his primary source of income. He is a responsible father of four children. He doesn’t want to raise them in poor living conditions for the rest of their lives, so he works hard to provide for their necessities.

To make further improvement to his business, Rolando is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers to use in his business.  This would be a big help in achieving progress.  Through his industriousness and hard work, he definitely supports his family’s needs and demands. He can also then save for their future.

loans.use: buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. У нее средне – специальное образование. По специальности она водитель. На сегодняшний день она предоставляет услугу, такси. Таким образом Гулнора зарабатывает на жизнь. Кредит берет для закупа запасных частей автомобиля и для замены шин.
texts.en: Gulnora lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She has a vocational education. She is a driver by profession. She provides a taxi service. That's how she makes a living. She is taking out a loan to buy spare parts and replacement tires.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and replacement tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build her house

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg is 45 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, ages 12, in the outer ger district Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, without the basic infrastructure of the city. Her daughter attends a local high school.

Oyunbileg supports her family by operating a recycling raw materials buying business.  She has been in this business for eleven years.  She buys recycling materials such as pots, bottles, brass, copper and sell them back to the factory.  Her husband helps her in the business. Their long term goal is to own an apartment and make better living condition for their daughter and to improve their business and increase their working capital. 

Today their working capital has decreased, so Oyunbileg needs capital in order to continue her own business. So she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Jeejan's Group

texts.en:
Jeejan is a 54-year-old responsible and kind woman. She operates a thread selling business. She gets thread from the used warm clothing and sells to different thread sellers in the market for profit.  She is very experienced in her work and has been doing it for many years. She does this work to help her husband financially as he is a factory worker on meager income.
 
Jeejan is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. All of her sons are involved in different work while her daughter stays at home and manages the household work.
 
Jeejan is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her thread selling business. She intends to use this loan to purchase used warm clothing in bulk to be able to get thread in large quantity for selling.  She is hopeful that her business will generate more revenue after this loan investment. 

In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Jeejan.

loans.use: buy warm clothes to extract thread to sell

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 61 год. Она замужем. У них четверо детей. Она занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом риса для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Marhabo is a resident of Tursun-zoda. She is 61 years old, married and has four children. She is a farmer and grows vegetables and rice for sale at the market. She has been a farmer for the last six years. Marhabo is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer and fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Suyunbubu

texts.ru:
Суюнбюбю 40 лет, замужем, воспитывает  5-х детей, младший из которых дошкольного возраста. Муж работает  на железной дороге в должности стрелка. 
С мая 2011 год, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Суюнбюбю решила заняться торговлей продуктами питания  в арендованном магазине, вложив  начальную сумму 30,000 сом (KGS). Приложив все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, Суюнбюбю добилась успеха – на сегодняшний день в ее товарообороте около 50,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего увеличения своего бизнеса, Суюнбюбю обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров. Доходы от кредита Суюнбюбю планирует вложить развитие животноводства, так как для сельской местности это является прибыльным бизнесом.
texts.en: Suyunbubu is 40 years old married and is raising five children, the youngest still a preschooler. Her husband works for the railroad as a railroad switch operator. In order to supplement family income, Suyunbubu has been selling groceries from a rented store starting May 2011. She used a starting capital of 30,000 som (KGS) to start her business and has been successful, as she now has 50,000 som (KGS) invested in her inventory. In order to further grow her business, Suyunbubu has turned to "Bai Tushum and partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to expand her inventory and attract additional clients. Suyunbubu is planning to use the profits from her loan to invest in a livestock business, as it is very profitable out in the countryside.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухарам проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст, 47 лет. Разведена. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Мухарам арендует торговую точку на рынке, где занимается продажей скатертей и полотенца. В этой области она десять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Muharam lives in the Gissar region. She is 47 years old, divorced and has two children. Muharam has a high school degree and makes a living by selling table cloths and towels from a rented market stall. She has been working in retail for the last 10 years. Muharam is taking out this loan to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Aimna's Group

texts.en:
Aimna has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son, who operates a shutter supply business. Shutter supplies are used in construction work and is a profitable business.

With this loan investment, Aimna's son will buy shutter material such as bamboos and ladders in larger quantity.  That will allow him to make more profit by providing better services to his clients.

Aimna also works. She has a milk selling business which she operates from her home. She provides good quality milk to her clients at low rates which helps her financially support her family.  She is very confident that her son's business will be improved after investing the loan into it.

Aimna is widow and lives with her only son. She wants him to marry in the near future.  She hopes that an improved income will help her save some profit for that purpose.

In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Aimna.

loans.use: To buy bamboos, ladders for shuttering supply business

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.en:
Aquilino started to manage his rice field in 1984.  He is 53 years old, is married, and has four children. He plants and harvests rice for sale. His wife is engaged in a hog-raising business for additional income. They work hard to give their children a good quality of life. 

Aquilino would like to expand his rice plantation but he has inadequate capital. Therefore, he is asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and pay labor costs required to plant rice. He believes that this loan will help him improve the business and he hopes that he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: buy rice seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor costs

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.ru: Шахринисо жительница города Душанбе. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое сыновей. Шахринисо имеет среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном она продает женские национальные свадебные платья и ткани с вышивками. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Shahriniso is a resident of Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. She is 45 years old, married and has two sons. Shahriniso has a high school degree and manages a market stall. The main focus of her store are traditional wedding dresses and embroidered fabrics. She is taking out this loan to increase inventory turnover.

loans.use: to increase inventory turnover

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lily has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy fish to sell.

Lily has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Mira has a shop that sells fish such as sardines, trout and mackerel. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.

Mira has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Propina

texts.en:
Propina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with seven children. 

Propina has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Propina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Propina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with five children. 

Antonio has a shop that sells fish such as trout, sardines and mackerel.  He has had this business for six years.  He has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.

Antonio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Antonio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is married with two children.  Glenn is 43-year-old and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, The Philippines.

Glenn owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale to earn a living.  He has been doing this for five years and every month he earns PHP 15,000 from this work.  He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in future.

Glenn has been a member of GDMPC for a year.  In the future, Glenn hopes that his children will have finished their studies and that he will be able to gain double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Naziran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Naziran bibi is married with five sons. Her elder son is married and involved in a milk and yogurt selling business. This is the only son who is not educated as he wouldn't put effort or time into studying. 
 
Naziran is very talented lady. She operates two businesses: one is grocery shop and another sells clothes. Both of her businesses are home-based. She has good client base in her community and earns a good income every month. Together with her husband, she uses her income to manage household expenses.

Her husband is also very talented businessman, operating a business selling clothes. He buys variety of clothes from different places and sells them to his clients. The quality and variety of his clothes attracts many customers which allows him to generate a good revenue. He has extensive experience in his work.
  
Naziran is requesting  a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use this loan to purchase clothes in bulk. The clothes will be varied, which will allow him to sell more and generate a good profit. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naziran bibi”.

loans.use: to buy clothes to be sold by her husband's business.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Ella has a shop that sells fish such as trout, sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.

Ella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Ella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Tuc's Group

texts.en:
Tuc is 42 years old and lives in Dong Thon village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh city. She has three children, one of them has a job and earns an income. 

Tuc and her husband are farmers. Not only does she grow rice but she also raises pigs and poultry and sells vegetables. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). The last time she received a loan, she borrowed 5.152.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the second time she has borrowed from SEDA. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 7.392.000 VND to buy vegetables to sell. She is the leader of an eight member group requesting a loan from SEDA. 

The other borrowers in the group are:  Nam, age 58, who wants to borrow 7.392.000 VND to breed pigs; Thanh, age 26, and Ha, age 21, who each want to borrow 7.392.000 VND to buy chicken feed; Xuan, age 47, who wants to borrow 7.392.000 VND to buy pigs; Ai, age 32, who wants to borrow 5.152.000 VND to breed pigs; Muon, age 51, who wants to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy pig feed and Mai, age 46, who wants to borrow 7.392.000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Rowelyn is making and peddling viands such as fried fish, fried chicken and vegetables soup.  She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Rowelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Rowelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Khiraymon

texts.ru: Хираймон проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 55 лет. Замужем. Имеет четверых детей. Она уже год занимается торговлей. У нее имеется собственный магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Khiraymon is a resident of Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. She is 55 years old, married and has four children. Khiraymon has been working in retail for a year. She owns a store where she sells groceries. Khiraymon is taking out this loan to purchase additional goods for her store and so increase inventory turnover.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary groceries

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Annabelle is providing a multipurpose cab service with her husband as the driver.  She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for her multipurpose cab service.

Annabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for her multipurpose cab service.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with five children. 

Lourdes is making and peddling viands such as fried fish, mongo soup and escabeche . She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel works as a farmer in his village.  He is providing for his two children and wife through this occupation.  He is proud to have this occupation because he can buy what he wants as well as provide the needs of his family.  At the age of 30, he is very capable in the farming business but he knows as time passes by he could also lose money. So he has promised himself, now that he is still young, he will save for the future of his children.

At this point, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the improvement of his business.

He knows that as his business gets better, his profits will also progress.  By then, he will save for the future necessities of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the improvement of his business.

loans.name: Bulicho A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bulicho A Group in Western Kenya! Zipporah is the facilitator of the Bulicho A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Zipporah takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Zipporah had a very good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Zipporah was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Zipporah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Zipporah will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bulicho A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Zipporah with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is married with one child. He is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Ian runs a business, providing transport services to the local community.  He has been doing this for three years, and makes PHP 9,248 monthly from his business. He has asked for a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to repair a vehicle he owns so that it can give a better service. 

Ian has been a member of GDMPC for two years. Ian hopes that he will be able to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle so it provides a better service.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children.
 
Randy has a shop that sells snacks and different kinds of beverages . He has had this business for three years. He has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy snacks and beverages to sell.

Randy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Randy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ziyodakhon

texts.ru: Зиёдахон жительница района Рудаки. Ей 24 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж имеет свою мастерскую, где занимается ремонтом легковых автомашин. Сама Зиёдахон у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей, чтобы сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Ziyodakhon is a resident of Rudaki region. She is 24 years old, married and has two children. Her husband runs a car repair shop and Ziyodakhon sews traditional Tajik dresses from home. She has been working as a seamstress for the last five years.  Ziyodakhon is taking out this loan to purchase more fabrics for sewing dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lorna has a shop that makes and sells home made sausages or longganisa. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy raw ingredients for making home made sausages.

Lorna  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making home made sausages.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Shirly has a pigpen that sells grown and mature pigs. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Shirly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Shirly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Naneth has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands such as adobo, afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw the ingredients needed for making viands.

Naneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Naneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Analiza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Analiza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a father who is raising his family in a village. He is 47 years old and has four children. He has been a farmer for 20 years. He usually plants rice and vegetables, and he raises hogs to sell. His ambition in life is to improve his family's standard of living and to give his children the education they need. Sometimes they encounter problems and difficulties, but with their strong determination, they persist.

Danilo cultivates one hectare of farmland where he plants rice. Due to insufficient capital, he requires an additional PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seeds. He believes that this loan will help him to improve his business. He is hoping for a plentiful harvest to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seeds.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Joyce is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Joyce is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as candies, shampoo and soaps.  Joyce has been in her business for over ten years and earns approximately PHP 5,955 a month from these activities.

Joyce is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  In 2010, Joyce joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Doris is the facilitator of the Baraka group. Doris and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Doris and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Doris joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Doris had a very good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Doris was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Doris will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Baraka group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Doris with her group members and the person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ediman

texts.en:
Ediman is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Ediman has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ediman has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ediman hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sharifan Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Sharifan Bibi is a 41-year-old, kind, and responsible woman. She sells flour to different grocery stores in her community at reasonable prices. Her husband works in a private organization for a meager income. He also supports Sharifan in her flour-selling business by delivering orders to her customers.  

Sharifan is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons are professional cobblers. They make shoes on order and financially contribute to the family with their earnings.

Sharifan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her flour business. She intends to use the loan to buy wheat in larger quantities, from which she will make flour to sell. She is hopeful that her business grow further after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy wheat for making flour.

loans.name: Oybegim

texts.ru: Ойбегим проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 23 года. Замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Занимается шитьем. Берет заказы на дому. В этой области она три года. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Oybegim lives in the Rudaki region. She is 23 years old, married and lives with her parents. Oybegim has been working as a seamstress from home for the last three years. She is taking out this loan to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul  is a 33-year-old married father of four children. He runs a welding business in Mnarani, Kilifi and has been in the business for the last four years. The business is doing well and he has been able to support his family well.

This marks Paul’s third loan from KADET LTD to finance his business, and with the money, he plans to purchase more metals for welding. 

With the anticipated profits he hopes to be able to repay his KADET loan and to expand his business even further, and also to improve his family’s living standards. In future, Paul hopes to open up new ventures in Kilifi and to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more metals for welding

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Jane is the facilitator of Baraka group. Jane and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Jane takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  she was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Jane will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Baraka group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land. Jane is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 6 children. 

Jimmy is providing tracking or multipurpose cab services. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for vehicle maintenance.

Jimmy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 52 years old and married to Nimo. He has run a Posho Mill for the past one-and-half years. His monthly income is KES 20,000 and with a first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, he intends to buy more maize. He plans to use the anticipated profits to purchase another miller and a husk remover. His future plan is to open more channels in strategic locations.

loans.use: to purchase maize stock for his store.

loans.name: Sinoko Shg Group

texts.en:
Abraham is the facilitator of the Sinoko SHG group. Abraham and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Abraham takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Abraham had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Abraham was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Abraham and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Abraham will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sinoko SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Abraham is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Juana has a shop from which she sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of NATASHA & AVON products.

Juana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Juana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of NATASHA & AVON products.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a 28-year-old business lady from the Mugen area of Vihiga County, Western Kenya. She is married to Walter, and they have two children.

Rael operates a boutique in the Mugen area selling clothing. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. This is her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy clothing stock. 

Her profits will be channeled to clearing the loan and also expanding the business. Rael hopes to repay well so that she qualifies for subsequent loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her boutique business.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a thirty-three year-old lady from Mugen area of Vihiga County, Western Kenya. She is married to Francis who is a farmer, and they have four children.

Violet operates an agro vet in Mugen area, a business she has done for the last ten years. She recently joined KADET to get access to micro funding, and has been awarded a first loan, which she will use to buy a stock of agro vet goods. 

She intends to use the profits to provide for her family, and at the same time invest in building a residential house for them. Her hope is to grow her business and get access to KADET funding.

loans.use: To buy more agro vet stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en: Moises, 42-years-old, is married. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in this business for sixteen years. With his last crop, he earns about PHP 25,000. As of now, he is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. Future loans from KIVA would be very useful to him as he sees the loans as the only chance for growth of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 38 years old and married to Lucy. They have been blessed with four children. He keeps poultry for the last seven years. His monthly income is KES 35,000, and he is servicing a first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. 

He intends to expand his business by acquisition of more chicks. He plans to use anticipated profits to help stabilize his business and therefore make it sustainable.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Askarkhon

texts.ru: Аскархон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Он вместе с сыном занимается развозкой пассажиров по маршруту Куляб – Душанбе. В этой области он уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для обновления салона и ремонта автомобиля.
texts.en: Askarkhon lives in the city of Kulob. He is 56 years old married and has four children. Together with his sons he is running a taxi shuttle business between Kulob and Dushanbe. He has been working as a taxi driver for the last 20 years and need this loan to repair his car and refurbish the car seats.

loans.use: To refurbish the upholstery and repair the car

loans.name: Joevelyn

texts.en:
Joevelyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Joevelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Joevelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joevelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Baraka C Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the facilitator of Baraka C group. Josephine and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Jospehine takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 3/4 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  she was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on 3/4 acres of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Josephine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
